entry.et: Middle English belongen, from be- + longen to be suitable long

def.dt: :to be suitable, appropriate, or advantageous a dictionary belongs in every home
:to be in a proper situation a man of his ability belongs in teaching
:to be the property of a person or thing used with to the book belongs to me
:to be attached or bound by birth, allegiance, or dependency usually used with to they belong to their homeland
:to be a member of a club, organization, or set usually used with to she belongs to a country club
:to be an attribute, part, adjunct, or function of a person or thing nuts and bolts belong to a car
